security: This document is marked TOP SECRET, restricting access to those approved for specific activities related to national security information. Unauthorized disclosure is subject to criminal sanctions.
summary: This is the President's Intelligence Checklist from November 27, 1963, covering topics such as Cuban SAM site activity, Syrian-Iraqi relations, Turkish government instability, Soviet agriculture and wheat purchases, Communist China's wheat and meat contracts, economic talks between Czechoslovakia and the USSR, Cambodia's request for a Geneva conference, Egypt's use of poison gas in Yemen, and a plot to assassinate the Congolese Premier.
summary_one_paragraph: The President's Intelligence Checklist, issued by the CIA on November 27, 1963, provides a global overview of intelligence matters. It reports on Cuban SAM site developments suggesting Cuban training is underway, examines Syrian-Iraqi relations, and details the potential collapse of the Turkish government. The checklist also assesses the dire state of Soviet agriculture necessitating wheat purchases, notes Communist China's import of wheat and meat, reports on Czech-USSR economic talks, and covers Cambodiaâ€™s diplomatic maneuvering. Further items include allegations of Egyptian use of poison gas in Yemen, plots to assassinate the Congolese Premier, and notes on South Korea's elections, assassination attempts in Venezuela, Sukarno's planned visit to the Philippines, and the lifting of a military alert in Cuba following President Kennedy's death.
title: THE PRESIDENT'S INTELLIGENCE CHECKLIST
